DataElement.preferredDefinition: An identifier for a specific point in time, including those relative to an event, as defined by the sponsor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS)._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).

Concepts.definition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC Domain Timepoint Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Identifier
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS)._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2: Any period of seven consecutive days.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Any period of seven consecutive days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::12: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A patient who is residing in the hospital where he is being treated.: The condition of being allowed to enter; the activity of admitting someone to something.

Concepts.definition: A patient who is residing in the hospital where he is being treated.
The condition of being allowed to enter; the activity of admitting someone to something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A starting point to which things may be compared.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated concept definition to match current NCIt. mc 4/13/17

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Enrollment; to insert, register, or enter in a list, catalog, or roll. (Merriam-Webster Online)

Concepts.definition: The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/1/24 added DICOM alt VM and Alt VM def; associated with DICOM tag (0012, 0053)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2: The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.: The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: CDISC Domain Timepoint Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Identifier
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. Concepts.definition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Clearly characterized or delimited.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
